column1: What gender do you identify with?
column4: Have you taken a class at the University of New Hampshire within the past 12 months?
column5: Are you a member of Service Credit Union? (You are considered a 'member' of SCU if you have at least a savings account with a balance of $5)
column6: If you are not a member of Service Credit Union, what is your Primary Financial Institution?
column7: I would recommend my Primary Financial Institution to a friend or family.
column8: I'm only with my Primary Financial Institution because of my family.
column9: I know the difference between a Bank and a Credit Union
column10: I have my own Checking and Savings account.
column11: If you have a Checking account, what is your average balance?
column12: If you have a Savings account, what is your average balance?
column13: I have a Credit card (NOT a Debit card).
column14: What makes you consider a Financial Institution worthwhile?
column15: What makes you consider a Financial Institution not worthwhile?
column16: What are your top 2 preferences when choosing a Financial institution?
column17: What promotions from Service Credit Union seem interesting (or worth looking into)?
column18: I felt comfortable with basic personal banking transactions (Basic personal banking transactions include: depositing money, withdrawing money, requesting a cashiers check, writing a check, keeping an account in good standing, understanding the features/fees of my account).
